snippet: Activists and militants expressed outrage over the disclosures about the global scope of American data mining and surveillance of private information conveyed over the Internet.
abstract: Activists and militants in Syria and other conflict zones express collective outrage over disclosures about global scope of American data mining and surveillance of phone records and private information conveyed through the Internet; in doing so, Taliban fighters and Qaeda operatives find themselves on same side of debate as human rights activists.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon; Declan Walsh from London; Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan; and Simon Romero and Lis Horta Moriconi from Rio de Janeiro.

lead_paragraph: Activists and militants expressed outrage over the disclosures about the global scope of American data mining and surveillance of private information conveyed over the Internet.

headline.seo: News of U.S. Surveillance Draws Anger Abroad
headline.main: News of U.S. Surveillance Draws Anger of Activists and Militants Abroad
headline.print_headline: News of U.S. Surveillance Draws Anger of Activists And Militants Abroad
